lead_paragraph: Franklin Reyes, 17, bragged on social media about his speeding habits. Those posts are now being used by prosecutors arguing that Mr. Reyes should be charged as an adult in the death of 4-year-old Ariel Russo.
snippet: Franklin Reyes, 17, bragged on social media about his speeding habits. Those posts are now being used by prosecutors arguing that Mr. Reyes should be charged as an adult in the death of 4-year-old Ariel Russo....
abstract: Prosecutors argue that Franklin Reyes, unlicensed teenage driver who struck and killed 4-year-old Ariel Russo while driving his family's SUV on Upper West Side of Manhattan, should be charged as adult; say that Reyes had driven recklessly before and bragged on social media about speeding, ignoring pleas from people he knew to be more cautious behind wheel.

headline.main: Driver in Crash Posted About Speeding
headline.print_headline: Driver in Crash Posted About Speeding
